tool_description: SEC Form D filing API. Get private company, hedge fund, private equity fund, and venture capital fund fundraising profiles. See connections between people, companies, and funds. Populate your CRM with phone numbers and addresses of companies and funds that are actively fundraising. Filter new filings by state, company/fund type, amount raised, etc. Our freemium API is available at a tiny fraction of the cost of Pitchbook, CB Insights, etc. Subscription tiers are available for internal use/CRM integration as well as public-facing websites looking to make use of our data.
name: DealData.net
title: DealData.net

api_list.name: Get Industries
api_list.description: This returns all of the available industries, or company types, in the database.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://fintoolbox-dealdata-net-v1.p.rapidapi.com/api.php?function=getIndustries"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "fintoolbox-dealdata-net-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Filing Profile (from Filing ID)
api_list.description: Given an internal filing ID (returned from another endpoint), this call returns a full filing profile.

api_list.name: Broker Search
api_list.description: Returns a list of brokers that match the given name fragment. NOTE: API responses are limited to 50,000 characters so the fragment provided must limit the result set so as not to exceed this limit.

api_list.name: Person Profile (from Person ID)
api_list.description: Given the person ID from a person search API call, this endpoint returns a full profile for that person.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://fintoolbox-dealdata-net-v1.p.rapidapi.com/api.php?function=personProfile&personid=11402"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "fintoolbox-dealdata-net-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Fund Types
api_list.description: Returns a list of available fund types for FUND filing feeds and searches.

api_list.name: Person Search
api_list.description: Fragments can be of any length, including a null string. NOTE: API call returns are limited to more than 50,000 characters each. As a result, you should provide enough of a guess as to the peroson's name so as to adequately limit the result set.

optional_parameters.name: first
optional_parameters.description: One or more characters from the person's first name.

optional_parameters.name: middle
optional_parameters.description: One or more characters from the person's middle name.

optional_parameters.name: last
optional_parameters.description: One or more characters from the person's last name.

api_list.name: Filing Feed/Search
api_list.description: This endpoint returns a filing feed based on any combination of a date range, entity type, range of amount raised, primary company/fund state.  It also allows a limit range to be set.  NOTE: all JSON return strings are limited to a maximum of 50 kilobytes.  Ensure that your query is sufficiently narrow, or an explicit result limit (<= 25 per call recommended) is set to ensure that the call does not return a 0 status.

required_parameters.name: entity
required_parameters.description: May be "FUND", "COMPANY", or "ALL".  Only filings of the specified type will be returned.

required_parameters.name: limit
required_parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.  It is not recommended to set this value higher than 25.  NOTE: All JSON values are limited to 50 kilobytes in size. If you set this parameter too large, your result set will not be returned.

required_parameters.name: first
required_parameters.description: The first result to return (starting from 0).  Modify this value to page through large result sets.

required_parameters.name: start
required_parameters.description: A start date of the format YYYY-mm-dd .  Only filings since this date (inclusive) will be returned.  Since filings are returned in descending date order, this parameter can be set to the distant past to not limit by date.

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description: May be set to one of the values returned by the Discover Available Parameters endpoints.  Separate values are provided for funds and companies.

optional_parameters.name: amountlow
optional_parameters.description: Only filings where the total amount sold is greater than this parameter will be returned.  Leave blank for no lower bound.

optional_parameters.name: amounthigh
optional_parameters.description: Only filings where no more than amounthigh USD was raised will be returned.  Leave blank for no upper bound.

optional_parameters.name: state
optional_parameters.description: Only filings whose primary entity is located in this two-letter US state code will be returned.  Leave blank for all states.

optional_parameters.name: end
optional_parameters.description: Optional end date (of the form YYYY-mm-dd) for the result set. If this is not set, the current date will be used. as the end date.

api_list.name: Broker Profile (from Broker ID)
api_list.description: Given the broker ID returned from a broker search, this endpoint returns a full broker profile.

api_list.name: Company Profile (from CIK)
api_list.description: Given a CIK number (the SEC identifier for the entity), this function returns a full company or fund profile for the entity.

api_list.name: Company/Fund Search
api_list.description: Finds all companies matching the name fragment. NOTE: All API requests are limited to a maximum return size of 50,000 characters. While there are no hard limits on how long of a fragment needs to be provided, the fragment provided should not return too many results or the response limit will be triggered.

api_list.name: Broker Profile (from CRD Number)
api_list.description: Given a FINRA Central Registration Depository (CRD) for a broker/dealer, this function returns a full broker profile.
